meanings.definition: To cover or coat with plaster again.
meanings.sent1: The old wall was replastered to make it smooth.
meanings.sent2: The painter replastered the ceiling to fix the cracks.
meanings.sent3: After the party, they replastered the broken pinata for the next celebration.
meanings.sent4: Her smile replastered any sadness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun replastered the sky with vibrant colors at sunset.

meanings.definition: To repair or renovate by applying a new layer of plaster.
meanings.sent1: The handyman replastered the damaged wall in no time.
meanings.sent2: They replastered the statue to restore its original beauty.
meanings.sent3: The chef replastered the burnt cake with fresh frosting.
meanings.sent4: His words replastered her broken heart with hope.
meanings.sent5: The rain replastered the sidewalk with shiny reflections.
